intro: Neochilenia malleolata, commonly known as the Chilean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Neochilenia malleolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant colors and unique floral structure.
